intro: Sacciolepis myosuroides, commonly known as the mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, alternate leaves that resemble mouse ears, hence its common name. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Sacciolepis myosuroides is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
